abstract.p: Fazal Khan letter says Yasir Arafat should step down and let more able and democratic leaders represent Palestinian people

Re ''Israel's Doomed Peace,'' by Allegra Pacheco (Op-Ed, Oct. 5):
Ms. Pacheco highlights that true peace will elude the Middle East until Israel recognizes that Palestinians are human beings with reciprocal rights of dignity and justice.

The United States should realize that ramming forward agreements skewed heavily in Israel's favor, like the Oslo accords, are not in the region's best interest, as they only guarantee further violence and injustice.

The fact that Yasir Arafat signed the Oslo accords and that, like other Arab governments, he has failed to uphold democratic norms demonstrates that he is not qualified to lead and should step down and let more able and democratic leaders represent the Palestinian people.
